segments.text: I notice the water overflowing from the sink, creating a puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's surprising how the woman hasn't noticed it yet, standing right next to it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the water is going to cause a lot of damage if it keeps overflowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets and floor are going to be ruined if someone doesn't turn off the faucet soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how calm everything seems despite the potential for a big mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit anxious just watching the water spill over like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman realizes what's happening before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger and bigger, and she's still just drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children will notice the water and say something to the woman.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this situation is a perfect example of how easily things can spiral out of control.
segments.speaker: PAR
